14db018f-37c0-494c-a085-97cfb363e04d:
A banishment {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is a more powerful version of the dismissal spell. It enables you to force extraplanar creatures out of your home plane. As many as 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} of creatures per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} can be banished in a 30-foot radius, and creatures who are closest to the burst's point of origin are affected first.
Dismissal: This spell forces an extraplanar creature back to its proper plane if it fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. If the spell is successful, the creature is instantly whisked away.
dbc01dfd-e08e-4b5a-9385-a4673bf9daf1:
A black ray projects from your pointing finger. You must succeed on a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} with the ray to strike a target.
The subject is immediately exhausted for the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s duration. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} means the creature is only fatigued.
A character that is already fatigued also becomes exhausted.
This spell has no effect on a creature that is already exhausted. Unlike normal exhaustion or fatigue, the effect ends as soon as the spell's duration expires.
420affc2-6283-4814-bae7-69ab1d231778:
A blast of furnace-hot wind blasts downward, inflicting {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} to all creatures in the area and knocking them prone. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} halves the fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and negates being knocked prone.
Any creature that takes damage from a sirocco becomes fatigued (or exhausted, if already fatigued, such as from a previous {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} of exposure to a sirocco {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}). Creatures with the water subtype take a -4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all saving throws against this spell and take double normal damage.
4c5a0bd1-c80c-407b-9c37-8b912b91dfc4: A blast of hellfire blazes from your hands. You can fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every 4 caster levels beyond 11th (to a maximum of three rays at 19th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15d6). Half the damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, but the other half results directly from unholy power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by fire resistance.
2d68e16d-c2dc-40c9-9172-87a254477925: A blue-white ray of freezing air and ice springs from your hand. You must succeed on a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} with the ray to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to a target. The ray deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 25d6) and 1d4 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} drain.
534accca-794a-481c-8685-c5c417d5e47e:
A brilliant divine radiance surrounds the subjects, protecting them from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resistance to spells{/g} cast by evil creatures, and causing evil creatures to become blinded when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.
First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.[LONGSTART] Unlike protection from evil, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by evil creatures.[LONGEND]
Second, each warded creature gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} resistance 25 against evil spells and spells cast by evil creatures.
Third, the abjuration protects from attempts to dominate or charm the subject.
Finally, if an evil creature succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against a creature warded by a holy aura, the offending attacker is blinded (Fortitude save negates, as blindness, but against holy aura's save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g}).
89cc62f8-316c-45cf-8b3b-89d66820b5c7:
A cloud of golden particles covers everyone and everything in the area, causing creatures to become blinded and visibly outlining invisible things for the duration of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. All within the area are covered by the dust, which cannot be removed and continues to sparkle until it fades. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} at the end of their turn, blinded creatures may attempt new Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} to end the blindness effect.
Any creature covered by the dust takes a â€“40 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}.
c65ae1c3-f3a2-47f4-a55b-f7c34b3c1336: A confused creature is mentally befuddled and cannot act normally.
eda236ca-e525-4e67-bbeb-fd8205dd1832: A coruscating ray springs from your hand. You must succeed on a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to strike a target. The subject takes a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g}+1 per two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum 1d6+5). The subject's Strength score cannot drop below 1. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} reduces this penalty by half. This penalty does not stack with itself. Apply the highest penalty instead.
c646d30f-13ac-4c32-baa9-955ba5e5364c: A creature targeted by this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is held immobile by glowing golden chains composed of pure light. The creature is paralyzed and held in place, but may attempt a new {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} to end the effect.[LONGSTART] While held by the golden chains, a creature cannot use any sort of extradimensional travel, such as dimension door and similar spells and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}.[LONGEND]
28f2f016-8bfb-4125-8a61-0176d60c6884: A creature under the effect of this enchantment enters a state of euphoria. Until the end of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s duration, the creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is halved, and it must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} each next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} to avoid being nauseated for 1 round.
6bddab18-3d95-4355-8309-81cf5a6ad57f:
A dim blue glow surrounds the subjects, protecting them from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resistance to spells{/g} cast by chaotic creatures, and slowing chaotic creatures when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.
First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.[LONGSTART] Unlike protection from chaos, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by chaotic creatures.[LONGEND]
Second, a warded creature gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} resistance 25 against chaotic spells and spells cast by chaotic creatures.
Third, the abjuration protects from all mind-affecting spells and effects.
Finally, if a chaotic creature succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against a warded creature, the attacker is slowed (Will save negates, as the slow spell, but against shield of law's save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g}).
ba231311-0708-481e-85e8-ffd9339be682: A favored blessing of halfling clerics, this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} grants its target a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects. If the target fails a saving throw against fear, it {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rerolls{/g} the save with a +4 morale bonus and takes the new result, even if it is worse. After that the spell's effect ends.
97fbb64a-bbd8-45ca-900f-447fdd5be594: A favored blessing of halfling clerics, this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} grants its target a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects. If the target fails a saving throw against fear, it {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rerolls{/g} the save with a +4 morale bonus and takes the new result, even if it is worse. After that the spell's effect ends. If the target has the fearless racial {g|Encyclopedia:Trait}trait{/g}, it is immune to fear instead.
3a122c0e-db1a-4d71-9bff-c377bb0b66c4: A fireball {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} generates a searing explosion of flame that detonates with a low roar and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 10d6) to every creature within the area.[LONGSTART] A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} halves this {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.[LONGEND]
fd69479f-3972-4d36-98f2-8d800f865695: A flame strike evokes a vertical column of divine fire. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15d6). Half the damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, but the other half results directly from divine power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by resistance to fire-based {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
d882fb83-d529-4a36-893b-d8a84829b675: A frightened creature takes a â€“2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}. A frightened creature may start to flee from its enemies.
fd26f13b-5150-4132-bfd1-d9382562d131: A glowing, rainbow-hued pattern of interweaving colors fascinates those within it. The rainbow pattern fascinates a maximum of 24 HD of creatures. An affected creature that fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} is fascinated by the pattern and becomes dazed.
b1fa1342-29b1-4772-9ea1-0a80e21aeb61: A grease {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} covers a solid surface with a layer of slippery grease. Any creature in the area when the spell is cast and every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after that must make a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} or fall prone.
c8d472a5-49c3-49b4-b182-9f5817c6ddfb:
A green ray springs from your hand. You must make a ranged touch attack to hit the target. Any creature or object struck by the ray is covered with a shimmering emerald field that completely blocks extradimensional travel. Forms of movement barred by a dimensional anchor include blink, dimension door, walk through space, teleport, and similar spell-like abilities.
A dimensional anchor does not interfere with the movement of creatures already in ethereal or astral form when the spell is cast, nor does it block extradimensional perception or attack forms. Also, dimensional anchor does not prevent summoned creatures from disappearing at the end of a summoning spell.
1294a62e-a249-4ac1-9877-d712032adfb5: A magical fire warms your belly, granting you fire resistance 5 and making your gut hot to the {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g} (but not enough to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} you or anything else). As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can breathe a 15-foot cone of flame that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} (Reflex half, SR applies). Each time you use this breath weapon, the remaining duration of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is reduced by 1 minute.
7360d5fb-13c9-4261-bc52-1ace33d329d3:
A malevolent darkness surrounds the subjects, protecting them from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resistance to spells{/g} cast by good creatures, and weakening good creatures when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.
First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.[LONGSTART] Unlike the effect of protection from good, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by good creatures.[LONGEND]
Second, warded creatures gain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} resistance 25 against good spells and spells cast by good creatures.
Third, the abjuration protects from attempts to dominate or charm the subject.
Finally, if a good creature succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against a warded creature, the offending attacker takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (Fortitude negates).
9262fe33-f425-4d4f-b9d8-4544e29138ba:
A missile of magical energy darts forth from your fingertip and strikes its target, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 points of force {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.[LONGSTART]
The missile strikes unerringly, even if the target is in melee combat, so long as it has less than total cover or total {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}. Specific parts of a creature can't be singled out. Objects are not damaged by the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.[LONGEND]
For every two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} beyond 1st, you gain an additional missile â€“ two at 3rd level, three at 5th, four at 7th, and the maximum of five missiles at 9th level or higher.
73c35918-2ac0-45be-ad7d-9a25ae7438ee:
A missile of magical energy darts forth from your fingertip and strikes its target, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 points of force {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.[LONGSTART]
The missile strikes unerringly, even if the target is in melee combat, so long as it has less than total cover or total {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}.[LONGEND]
For every two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} beyond 1st, you gain an additional missile â€“ two at 3rd level, three at 5th, four at 7th, and the maximum of five missiles at 9th level or higher.
abb14e36-f6bd-4251-a36a-208248dc9323: A pale glow surrounds and outlines the subjects. Outlined subjects shed light as candles. Creatures outlined by faerie fire take a â€“20 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. Outlined creatures do not benefit from the {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} normally provided by darkness (though a 2nd-level or higher magical darkness effect functions normally), blur, displacement, invisibility, or similar effects.
d48f1fd6-d6eb-4463-8d01-ff209ea4e687: A pale glow surrounds and outlines the subjects. Outlined subjects shed light as candles. Creatures outlined by faerie fire take a â€“20 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. Outlined creatures do not benefit from the {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} normally provided by darkness (though a 2nd-level or higher magical darkness effect functions normally), blur, displacement, invisibility, or similar effects.[LONGSTART] The light is too dim to have any special effect on undead or dark-dwelling creatures vulnerable to light.[LONGEND]
e89687d1-f8cd-4aa7-a7c4-bd8140e81244: A pile of gold turned into a handful of sand. But perhaps the next one will remain as gold?
295f8940-2c6c-439f-818d-8b1ff7dc6d40:
A rain of dirt, gravel, and small pebbles fills the area, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} to every creature in the area. This {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} only occurs once, when the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is cast.
For the remaining duration of the spell, this debris covers the ground, making the entire area difficult terrain.
ac79e469-8fb8-4d9f-84f4-e353f650b3cb:
A random pattern of color surrounds the subjects, protecting them from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resistance to spells{/g} cast by lawful creatures, and causing lawful creatures that strike the subjects to become confused. This abjuration has four effects.
First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.[LONGSTART] Unlike protection from law, the benefit of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by lawful creatures.[LONGEND]
Second, each warded creature gains spell resistance 25 against lawful spells and spells cast by lawful creatures.
Third, the abjuration protects from all mind-affecting spells and effects.
Finally, if a lawful creature succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against a warded creature, the offending attacker is confused for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (Will save negates, as with the confusion spell, but against the save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of cloak of chaos).
9cc61d11-0709-4c46-b1ee-7ed3acc6e89f: A ray of freezing air and ice projects from your pointing finger. You must succeed on a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} with the ray to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to a target. The ray deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g}.
fb7d2136-6812-470f-959d-835e1934c802:
A ray of sickly greenish-gray negative energy issues forth from the palm of your hand.
Make a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} against the target. A creature hit by this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is wracked by painful spasms as its muscles and sinews wither and twist.
The subject takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} you possess (maximum 5d4 each). This spell cannot reduce an {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} below 1. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} halves the damage.
0a64264f-3220-4b23-88a6-7133801fed36: A shaken character takes a â€“2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}. Shaken is a less severe state of fear than frightened.
18fd68a7-f721-4512-8f21-08f09ca9a3a5: A sleep {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes a magical slumber to come upon 4 HD of creatures, and those who are closest to the spell's point of origin are affected first. HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted. Sleeping creatures are {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}. Wounding awakens an affected creature, but normal noise does not. Sleep does not target {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} creatures, constructs, or undead creatures.
ff7e8789-4f47-447b-8fda-a57bb1761f15: A spray of acid erupts from your outstretched hand, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15d6) to each creature within its area (Reflex half). This acid continues to burn for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At the end of this round every creatures that failed their {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} must succeed on another Reflex save or receive 1d6 points of acid {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per two caster levels (maximum 7d6).
a0257bb1-c228-48af-a5f3-bfce353f12f6:
A thin, green ray springs from your pointing finger.[LONGSTART] You must make a successful ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit.[LONGEND] Any creature struck by the ray takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (to a maximum of 40d6). Any creature reduced to 0 or fewer {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} by this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is entirely disintegrated, leaving behind only a trace of fine dust. A disintegrated creature's equipment is unaffected.[LONGSTART] The ray affects objects constructed entirely of force, such as forceful hand or a wall of force, but not magical effects such as a globe of invulnerability or an antimagic field.[LONGEND]
A creature or object that makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} is partially affected, taking only 5d6 points of damage. If this damage reduces the creature or object to 0 or fewer hit points, it is entirely disintegrated.
Only the first creature or object struck can be affected; that is, the ray affects only one target per casting.
bfe36175-fcb0-4cc1-9703-e3ce3b668aa5:
A twisting pattern of coruscating colors weaves through the air, affecting creatures within. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} affects a total number of HD of creatures equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20). Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first, and among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the spell's point of origin are affected first. HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted. The spell affects each subject according to its HD.
6 or less: {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}Unconscious{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, then stunned for the same amount of rounds, and then confused for the same amount of rounds. (Treat an unconscious result as stunned for nonliving creatures.)
7 to 12: Stunned for 1d4 rounds, then confused for the same amount of rounds.
13 or more: Confused for 1d4 rounds.
Sightless creatures are not affected by scintillating pattern.
81e54296-8e03-489b-a15d-a73a4a27a84d:
A vivid cone of clashing colors springs forth from your hand, causing creatures to become stunned, perhaps also blinded, and possibly knocking them prone. Each creature within the cone is affected according to its HD.
2 HD or less: The creature is blinded, stunned, and knocked prone for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, then blinded and stunned for 1d4 rounds, and then stunned for 1 round.[LONGSTART] (Only living creatures are knocked prone.)[LONGEND]
3 or 4 HD: The creature is blinded and stunned for 1d4 rounds, then stunned for 1 round.
5 or more HD: The creature is stunned for 1 round.[LONGSTART]
Sightless creatures are not affected by color spray.[LONGEND]
e94c85f0-901f-4897-a15d-7fe32c177aa3: A {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}chaotic-aligned{/g} weapon can bypass the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} of certain creatures.
82ee8cee-c251-471d-8295-88efeab4e256: A {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} weapon can bypass the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} of certain creatures.
395871b1-b29e-42cb-b4d5-23fd0640d263: A {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}lawful-aligned{/g} weapon can bypass the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} of certain creatures.
df954758-6bfb-43c0-b480-399fde452b1d: Acid erupts from your space in all directions, causing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d6) to creatures and unattended objects in the area. Each of the next 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, creatures and objects that failed their {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against the initial burst take an additional 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per 2 caster levels (maximum 10d6) unless the acid is dispelled.
3c7c46b5-205d-497e-a5ea-41712d5b74b0: Acid fog creates a billowing mass of highly acidic, misty vapors that slow down creatures. Creatures moving through acid fog move at half their normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and take a â€“2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} and melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. The vapors prevent effective ranged weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting all creatures inside the fog a +8 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against normal {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g}. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} on your turn, starting when you cast the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, the fog deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} to each creature and object within it.
0a6b0fb8-c882-4b15-8043-19faa5330223: After the battle, you can dismiss area {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} effect at will. You must be out of combat and within a 100-foot range of the spell's effect. 3679a54d-9da0-4fd8-a1d1-c885de182d36: Allies in the area of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} at the time of casting gain a +1 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against fear effects, plus 1 temporary hit point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20).

83733c1b-9fc4-4ddb-9eaa-90300e0a5095: An arrow of acid springs from your hand and speeds to its target. You must succeed on a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit your target. 71afb990-423e-4bf4-938c-601f42c7bc5a: An entangled creature moves at half {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, cannot run or charge, and takes a â€“2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and a â€“4 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. Any chaotic evil, chaotic good, lawful evil, or lawful good creatures within the area of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} suffer the following ill effects:
If the creature's HD is equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, it is sickened.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level â€“ 1, it is staggered and sickened.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level â€“ 5, it is nauseated, staggered, and sickened.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level â€“ 10, it is killed, nauseated, staggered, and sickened.
The effects are cumulative and concurrent. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces or eliminates these effects. Creatures affected by multiple effects make only one save and apply the result to all of the effects. Creatures whose {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} exceed your caster level are unaffected by arbitrament.
843c195d-ca95-4af9-9375-5c5f9a18f44f: Any creature in the area of the flames takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 5d4).
674efbb8-8cca-42ff-b7fe-7203082c0072: Any creature that strikes you with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} deals normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, but also takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +15).[LONGSTART] Creatures with {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} weapons are not subject to this damage if they {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} you.[LONGEND]
d7c86817-33b5-4d6d-9bbb-9d8d3502a6a2: Any creature within the area that fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} becomes drowsy and inattentive, taking a -5 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g} and a -2 penalty on Will saves against sleep effects while the lullaby is in effect.

223eab56-16d8-4c02-9136-6b6beef13397: Armor you wear no longer reduces your {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. You also reduce the armor's armor {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} by 1 + 1 per five {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum 5).

3e8f1959-d69d-4339-bd0e-b7d66552c088: Bane fills your enemies with fear and doubt. The enhancement bonus provided by barkskin stacks with the target's natural armor bonus, but not with other enhancement bonuses to natural armor. A creature without natural armor has an effective natural armor bonus of +0.

Chanting an unholy litany, you reach out with a grasping motion toward your target and cause its heart to leap out of its chest and into your hand.

Regardless of its current hit points, if the target succeeds at its Fortitude save, it is still staggered for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as it feels its heart wrenching within its chest.

Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, you can target a single living creature, striking it with waves of power. The target must make a successful Fortitude saving throw, or suffer the spell's harmful effects. Depending on the target's HD, this {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} has as many as three effects:
If the target's HD is 10 or more, it is sickened for 10 minutes per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
If the target's HD is 5â€“9, it is frightened and sickened for 10 minutes per caster level.
If the target's HD is 4 or less, it is paralyzed, frightened, and sickened
The effects are cumulative and concurrent for 10 minutes per caster level.
You must spend a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} each round after the first to target a foe.
40d604bf-1855-4f28-99f5-834f6ab44243: Entreating your deity for aid, you make a temporary oath of peace, granting you superior defenses but meaning you can't {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} for the duration of the oath. 28f11c6f-1bb8-430e-9d26-73b6c732f0fe: For the duration of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, the subject ignores the adverse movement effects of difficult terrain.
7a7f43e9-7d73-46b0-b48b-af7bc16c4732: For the duration of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, you can use a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} to evoke a dazzling beam of intense light each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. e521ad0c-3c4d-41b6-9e53-fb6248b1c1e2: For the duration of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, you gain a +2 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}. Physical {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} against you have a 50% miss chance and the Blind Fight {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} doesn't help opponents, since you're ethereal and not merely invisible. If the attack is capable of striking ethereal creatures, the miss chance is only 20% (for {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}). Any individually targeted {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} has a 50% chance to fail against you while you're blinking unless your attacker can target invisible, ethereal creatures.
If the attacker can see invisible creatures, the miss chance is also only 20%. For an attacker who can both see and strike ethereal creatures, there is no miss chance.
Likewise, your own attacks have a 20% miss chance. While blinking, you take only half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from area attacks (but full damage from those that extend onto the Ethereal Plane). Although you are only partially visible, you are not considered invisible and targets retain their {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against your attacks. You do receive a +2 bonus on attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} made against enemies that cannot see invisible creatures.

When the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} absorbs 12 points per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} (to a maximum of 120 points at 10th level), it is discharged.[LONGSTART] Once the spell absorbs 12 points of energy {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per caster level (maximum 120 points) for a subject, the spell's effects end for that subject.[LONGEND]

ec7d11e9-4770-4eea-8547-eaf37c8bc8ed:
Rocky ground, stone floors, and similar surfaces shape themselves into long, sharp points that blend into the background.
Spike stones impede progress through an area and deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Any creature moving on foot into or through the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s area moves at half {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. In addition, each creature moving through the area takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} for each 5 feet of movement through the spiked area.
Any creature that takes damage from this spell must also succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} to avoid {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}injuries{/g} to its feet and legs. A failed save causes the creature's speed to be reduced to half normal for 1 minute.
e5a72d7a-b7f7-46d1-aa4f-1fca3e763201: Shards of rock drop from above, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning{/g} and piercing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (Reflex half). A creature that fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} is pinned to the ground under stalactites and rubble, gaining the entangled condition until it can free itself with a successful {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 15 {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} or DC 20 {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility check{/g}.
17d92db2-d82a-469b-a360-03d8b177ed10: Shield creates an invisible shield of force that hovers in front of you. It negates magic missile {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} directed at you. You instantly transfer yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You can also bring with you all friendly creatures within a 10-foot radius.
f458330b-91f7-4c2a-9afd-3d6c59a68844: Stinking cloud creates a bank of fog like that created by fog cloud, except that the vapors are nauseating. Living creatures in the cloud become nauseated. All creatures in the globe are blinded and take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}6d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} negates the blindness and reduces the damage by half.

484fd3ab-14cf-471e-ad54-be91bbde1ae3: Target unit gains a +1 bonus to saving throws and AC and DR 1/- for 3 rounds, and also a +(20 + Power/5) bonus to combat morale. This is an Arcane spell with a mind-affecting effect.
1afc4a62-4c71-4489-b52e-866bb1841a89: Target unit receives a -2 penalty to attack, a -5 penalty to initiative, and a -30 penalty to combat morale. This is a mind-affecting effect.
150e323a-0978-49ab-835c-05143fd8b06a: The Hand of the Inheritor has to stay hidden from demon eyes by taking the form of incorporeal haze, unseen to any evil creature born of the Abyss. He is always nearby, and should the Commander start losing in battle, the herald will come to lend his aid.
ec0628d5-4596-4191-96f6-2dec6cffa58d: The affected creature becomes frightened. If the subject succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}, it is shaken for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. ed2d37ff-64bd-4505-8b22-32ea4887c0a7: The affected creature gains greater vitality and stamina. e32cb67e-c3c7-4aa9-92d5-122812831520:
The affected creature suffers from a continuous confusion effect, as the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.

Confusion: This spell causes confusion in the targets, making them unable to determine their {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}. {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}Roll{/g} d100 and consult the following table at the start of each subject's turn each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} to see what it does in that round.
01â€“25: Acts normally
26â€“50: Does nothing but babble incoherently
51â€“75: Deals 1d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Str{/g} modifier to self with item in hand
76â€“100: {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}Attacks{/g} nearest creature (for this purpose, a familiar counts as part of the subject's self)
084143c9-2ead-4239-9553-fe5fbcd6bf29: The affected creatures or objects fall slowly, and take no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} upon landing while the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is in effect. When the spell duration expires, a normal rate of falling resumes.
75d4723c-ed35-440a-bb8d-f04f6b4098de: The bones of your targets' joints grow thick and sharp, protruding painfully through the skin at the knuckles, elbows, shoulders, spine, and knees. 8dc5b042-62a5-4e56-93cf-dada0fc2bfd1: The character is frozen in fear and can take no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}. 00424e2e-6ba7-4e42-9e5b-e704fd35ea8f: The character is lying on the ground. A prone creature cannot {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. The creature cannot see. It takes a â€“2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} and loses its {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus to AC (if any). Blindness can be removed by remove blindness {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
d0776561-aec6-41eb-ae76-88cce891dc89: The creature is unable to act normally. A dazed creature can take no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, but has no {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. It stops being dazed if wounded.
4aee55cb-613f-4f33-9d4c-f2abaae01edf: The creature is unable to see well because of overstimulation of the eyes. A dazzled creature takes a â€“1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and sight-based {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
e34850a5-1bb5-4065-adb0-593e9a7ccada:
The creature or object touched becomes invisible.
If a {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} is required, a stationary invisible creature has a +40 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on its {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. This bonus is reduced to +20 if the creature is moving. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} ends if the subject {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} any creature.[LONGSTART] For purposes of this spell, an attack includes any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Target}spell targeting{/g} a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. Exactly who is a foe depends on the invisible character's {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}perceptions{/g}. {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}Actions{/g} directed at unattended objects do not break the spell. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. Thus, an invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon monsters and have them attack, cut the ropes holding a rope bridge while enemies are on the bridge, remotely trigger traps, open a portcullis to release attack dogs, and so forth. If the subject attacks directly, however, it immediately becomes visible along with all its gear. Spells such as bless that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area.[LONGEND]
2f01eeff-14ec-44d6-8601-b5cb167ecc59: The creature you designate is surrounded by a glowing red aura of vengeful fate. Once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} when the target makes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} or casts a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, it must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + 1/2 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} + {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}. If the target fails the saving throw, it takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} + your Wisdom modifier {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}. It takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful saving throw.

d44d2109-b508-4074-bab2-ba0ae4fb0d54:
The target animal grows to twice its normal {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} and eight times its normal weight. This alteration changes the animal's size category to the next largest, grants it a +8 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and a +4 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} (and thus an extra 2 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per HD), and imposes a â€“2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. The creature's existing natural armor bonus to AC increases by 2.
The size change also affects the animal's modifier to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, and its base {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The animal's space and {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} change as appropriate to the new size, but its {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} does not change. Multiple magical effects that increase size do not stack.
2068da3d-b478-4316-8749-b712622c4b44: The target becomes smarter. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, adding the usual benefits to Intelligence-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} and other uses of the Intelligence modifier.[LONGSTART] Wizards (and other spellcasters who rely on Intelligence) affected by this spell do not gain any additional bonus spells for the increased Intelligence, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs for spells they cast while under this spell's effect do increase. This spell doesn't grant extra skill ranks.[LONGEND]

While in whirlwind form, it cannot attack but it is able to use its abilities.

The shambling mound attempts a grapple {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} against its target, and on a successful check its vines deal 2d6+5 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and the foe is grappled.
Grappled characters cannot move, and take a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all attack rolls and a -4 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. Grappled characters attempt to escape every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} by making a successful combat maneuver, Strength, {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility check{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this check is the shambling mound's {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}.
Each round, creatures grappled by a shambling mound suffer (4d6 + twice the Strength modifier) damage.
A shambling mound receives a +4 bonus on grapple maneuver checks.

29b674f8-26e2-4323-ab8b-a57f2f8e4bf2: The target creature gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against mind-affecting effects that rely on negative emotions (such as crushing despair, rage, or fear effects) or that would force them to harm an ally (such as confusion). 4d28c067-516d-4af8-9a90-ef49e5096bbd: This secret banishes extraplanar creatures, forcing them out of your home plane.
