The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this spell is increased by 2 against creatures of chaotic {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}.
4b34e4e2-9026-4375-b65a-531041751623: This secret subdues all hostile creatures within range. Humanoid creatures whose number of {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} is less or equal to half your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 10) lose their will to fight completely, leave their worldly possessions and weapons on the spot and leave to travel the world seeking salvation. Other creatures whose number of Hit Dice is less or equal to your caster level become frightened, fleeing from you. Creatures with more HD than your caster level are instead fascinated â€” any aggressive {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} against one of these creatures breaks the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s effect. This is a mind-affecting effect. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this spell is increased by 2 against creatures of chaotic {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}.
2d9844a0-e843-4bff-a144-d81acdcaeb01: This special quality makes a creature's very presence unsettling to foes. Opponents within a range of 30 feet who witness the creature may become frightened or shaken for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. This ability affects only opponents with fewer {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} than the creature has. An opponent can resist the effects with a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. An opponent that succeeds on their saving throw is immune to that same creature's frightful presence for 24 hours. On a failed save, the opponent is shaken, or frightened if it has 4 Hit Dice or fewer. Frightful presence is a mind-affecting fear effect.
07a80aaa-15c5-4754-9dbb-3e499478a014: This transmutation makes a weapon strike true against evil foes. The weapon in your primary hand is treated as a magic weapon for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g}. The weapon also becomes {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g}, which means it can overcome the DR of certain evil creatures. In addition, all {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threats against evil foes automatically confirm, so every threat is a critical hit.
d1b98530-5e3b-454f-9196-a8770a89a935: This {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrip{/g} creates a burst of light. If you cause the light to burst in front of a single creature, that creature is dazzled for 1 minute unless it makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}.[LONGSTART] Sightless creatures, as well as creatures already dazzled, are not affected by flare.[LONGEND]
47b3bf1f-185c-4f88-9964-2dea1b846810: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} afflicts the subject with uncontrollable laughter. It collapses into gales of manic laughter, falling prone. The subject can take no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} while laughing, but is not considered {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}. After the spell ends, it can act normally. On the creature's next turn, it may attempt a new Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} to end the effect.[LONGSTART] A creature with an {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} score of 2 or lower is not affected.[LONGEND]
3a312b8e-3b30-40fb-a0e7-4c1e8f233869: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} allows you to channel holy power into the weapon in your primary hand. The weapon acts as a +5 holy weapon (+5 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} damage against evil opponents). It also emits a magic circle against evil effect (as the spell).
fb550fe0-5014-4b5e-b04c-372a1184f1e3: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} allows you to peer into the secrets of Suramgamin briefly and uses them for your benefit. There are five secrets, and you choose one every time you cast this spell. Only good characters can use this spell.
9c77d01b-19ca-4a8b-9aa6-d097c0e236e6: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} allows you to take the form of a wide variety of creatures. This spell can function as beast shape IV, elemental body IV and dragonkind III depending on what form you take. You can change form once each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. The change takes place either immediately before your regular {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} or immediately after it, but not during the action.
efd558c1-529f-4e09-8ace-7ec6022dc4ae: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes a brushy beard of stiff iron to erupt from the face of a willing target. The ironbeard grants a +1 armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, and this bonus stacks with any armor worn by the creature. The ironbeard makes it difficult to speak, so any spellcasting with a verbal component has a 20% {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}spell failure chance{/g}.
6b804ff7-82c5-49b6-addb-1f6c9eba3be9:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes a touched party member to glow like a torch, shedding normal light in a 20-foot radius from the point touched.[LONGSTART]
You can only have one light spell active at any one time. If you cast this spell while another casting is still in effect, the previous casting is dispelled.[LONGEND]
6e4470d8-3b5c-4134-9a4b-8ca1c1d04111:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes an arc of flame to leap from your fingers, burning a number of enemies nearby. It deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 10d6). For every additional target the discharge arcs to, reduce the number of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dice by half (rounded down). Therefore, at 9th level, your burning arc deals 9d6 points of fire damage to the primary target, then 4d6 points of fire damage to a secondary target, then 2d6 points of fire damage to an additional target.
Each target can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} for half damage.
f9114e33-b3e3-472e-8b86-b60b850cb8db:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes an arc of flame to leap from your fingers, burning one enemy nearby plus one additional enemy per 3 caster levels, each of which must be within 15 feet of the primary target.
It deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 10d6) to the primary target. For every additional target, reduce the number of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dice by half (rounded down).
Each target can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} for half damage.
d5172126-1d9e-4358-b2a1-91ed250aa64d:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes confusion in the targets, making them unable to determine their {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}. {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}Roll{/g} d100 and consult the following table at the start of each subject's turn each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} to see what it does in that round.
01â€“25: Acts normally
26â€“50: Does nothing but babble incoherently
51â€“75: Deals (1d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier) to self with item in hand
76â€“100: {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}Attacks{/g} nearest creature (for this purpose, a familiar counts as part of the subject's self)
23f2921f-8b3f-40af-9cf0-2cf7d963c82f:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes instant diminution of a humanoid creature, halving its height, length, and width and dividing its weight by 8. This decrease changes the creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category to the next smaller one. The target gains a +2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, a â€“2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} (to a minimum of 1), and a +1 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} due to its reduced size. Melee and ranged weapons used by this creature deal less {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.[LONGSTART]
A Small humanoid creature whose size decreases to Tiny has a space of 2.5 feet and a natural {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} of 0 feet (meaning that it must enter an opponent's square to attack). A Large humanoid creature whose size decreases to Medium has a space of 5 feet and a natural reach of 5 feet. This spell doesn't change the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
Reduce person dispels enlarge person.[LONGEND]
6a45d7fa-fcbf-4127-bb5d-f296542a8ba0:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes instant diminution of all allied humanoid creatures, halving their height, length, and width and dividing their weight by 8. This decrease changes the creatures' {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category to the next smaller one. The targets gain a +2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, a â€“2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} (to a minimum of 1), and a +1 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} due to their reduced size. Melee and ranged weapons used by this creature deal less {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.[LONGSTART]
A Small humanoid creature whose size decreases to Tiny has a space of 2.5 feet and a natural {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} of 0 feet (meaning that it must enter an opponent's square to attack). A Large humanoid creature whose size decreases to Medium has a space of 5 feet and a natural reach of 5 feet. This spell doesn't change the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
Reduce person dispels enlarge person.[LONGEND]
98e96c12-faa0-46d9-b5bc-bced6058b77c:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes instant growth of a humanoid creature, doubling its height and multiplying its weight by 8. This increase changes the creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category to the next larger one. The target gains a +2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a â€“2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} (to a minimum of 1), and a â€“1 penalty on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} due to its increased size. Melee and ranged weapons used by this creature deal more {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.[LONGSTART]
A humanoid creature whose size increases to Large has a space of 10 feet and a natural {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} of 10 feet. This spell does not change the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
Enlarge person dispels reduce person.[LONGEND]
dc299d89-2059-4ae9-b1bd-2bd8b5cc59b5:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes instant growth of all allied humanoid creatures in 15 feet, doubling their height and multiplying their weight by 8. This increase changes the creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category to the next larger one. The targets gains a +2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a â€“2 size {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} (to a minimum of 1), and a â€“1 penalty on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} due to its increased size. Melee and ranged weapons used by this creature deal more {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.[LONGSTART]
A humanoid creature whose size increases to Large has a space of 10 feet and a natural {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} of 10 feet. This spell does not change the targets' {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
Enlarge person dispels reduce person.[LONGEND]
f44c5d76-df53-4cc9-9cec-ccd3fdaf9c49:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes seven shimmering, multicolored beams of light to spray from your hand. Each beam has a different power. Creatures in the area of the spell with 8 HD or less are automatically blinded for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. Every creature in the area is randomly struck by one or more beams, which have additional effects:
20 points {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} (Reflex half)
40 points acid {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (Reflex half)
80 points electricity damage (Reflex half)
Poison (Frequency 1/rd. for 6 rds.; Init. effect {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}; Sec. effect 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Con{/g}/rd.; {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Cure{/g} 2 consecutive Fort {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g})
Baleful Polymorph (Fortitude negates)
Insane, as insanity spell (Will negates)
Sent to another plane forever (Will negates)
Creature struck by two rays receives both rays' effects at once.
654a5cd8-76e6-4914-8e1b-7ec21da47323:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes spines to grow from your exposed skin, damaging creatures that strike you. Any creature striking you with a melee weapon, an {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike, or a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +15). Creatures using melee weapons with {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} are unaffected by this spell.
In addition, your natural {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and unarmed strikes deal an additional 1d6 points of piercing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
7f136d23-ede2-4bb4-8916-d7d130701e9a:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes spines to grow from your exposed skin, damaging creatures that strike you. Any creature striking you with a melee weapon, an {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike, or a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +15). Creatures using melee weapons with {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} are unaffected by this spell. Creatures that successfully grapple you take 2d6 points of piercing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per caster level (maximum +15).
In addition, your natural {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and unarmed strikes deal an additional 1d6 points of piercing damage.
9b1b21c7-c6e2-477c-a774-04eed1396f59:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes tall grass, weeds, and other plants to wrap around creatures in the area of effect or those that enter the area. Creatures that fail their Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} gain the entangled condition. Creatures that succeed at their save can move as normal, but those that remain in the area must save again each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Creatures that move into the area must save immediately.
Entangled creatures can break free by making a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics check{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility check{/g} against the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this spell every round.
The entire area of effect is considered difficult terrain while the effect lasts.
8c11eba3-9185-44f2-8fab-0fe3372756e4: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} causes those within the area to turn on each other rather than {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} their foes. Each affected creature has a 50% chance to attack the nearest target each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}Roll{/g} to determine each creature's behavior every round at the beginning of its turn.) A creature that does not attack its nearest neighbor is free to act normally for that round.
dba288f7-5aa6-4b4f-bc06-9ae142e321e0: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} changes an ordinary quarterstaff into a treant creature. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
34dec557-ad81-4e58-a93b-a4f01287f668: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} charges your hand with telekinetic force. Your successful melee {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of force {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per level (maximum 10d4) and causes the target to be pushed away from you in a straight line up to 5 feet per two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} negates the movement but not the damage.
c0e86d7a-781f-4a36-bedf-443d46c88a35:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} clouds the mind of a humanoid creature with 4 or fewer {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} so that it takes no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}. Humanoids of 5 or more HD are not affected.[LONGSTART] A dazed subject is not stunned, so attackers get no special advantage against it. After a creature has been dazed by this spell, it is immune to the effects of this spell for 1 minute.
Dazed Condition: The creature is unable to act normally. A dazed creature can take no actions, but has no {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.[LONGEND]
99c58d16-b733-45e9-a8d2-90f64a8342ef:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} creates a number of illusory doubles of you that inhabit your square. These doubles make it difficult for enemies to precisely locate and {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} you.
When mirror image is cast, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} images plus one image per three {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum eight images total) are created.[LONGSTART] These images remain in your space and move with you, mimicking your movements, sounds, and {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} exactly.[LONGEND] Whenever you are attacked or are the target of a spell that requires an attack roll, there is a possibility that the attack targets one of your images instead.[LONGSTART] If the attack is a hit, roll randomly to see whether the selected target is real or a figment. If it is a figment, the figment is destroyed. If the attack misses by 5 or less, one of your figments is destroyed by the near miss. Area spells affect you normally and do not destroy any of your figments. Spells and effects that do not require an attack roll affect you normally and do not destroy any of your figments. Spells that require a {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} are harmlessly discharged if used to destroy a figment.
An attacker must be able to see the figments to be fooled. If you are invisible or the attacker is blind, the spell has no effect (although the normal miss chances still apply).[LONGEND]
0117ed73-d023-4ec8-80b5-770a7fe50a67: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} creates a shimmering, magical field around the target that averts and deflects {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. The spell grants the subject a +2 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, with an additional +1 to the bonus for every six levels you have (maximum +5 deflection bonus at 18th level).
972d2dc4-caaa-48b5-9488-26ad8d11d44d:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} creates an electrical discharge that begins as a single stroke commencing from your fingertips. [LONGSTART]Unlike lightning bolt, chain lightning strikes one object or creature initially, then arcs to other targets.[LONGEND]
The bolt deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d6) to the primary target. After it strikes, lightning can arc to a number of secondary targets equal to your caster level (maximum 20). The secondary bolts each strike one target and deal as much {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as the primary bolt.
Each target can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} for half damage. Secondary targets must be within 30 feet of the primary target, and no target can be struck more than once.
6c9799c6-f7d1-4279-afb4-07308a899fc2: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} cures {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +25) and ends any and all of the following adverse conditions affecting you: {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, blinded, confused, dazzled, diseased, exhausted, fatigued, nauseated, poisoned, and sickened.
3c13dd71-0d76-47fb-a1c0-c2eded2b9bbc:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} cures {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +25).
Unlike other spells that {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} damage, breath of life can bring recently slain creatures back to life. If cast upon a creature that has died within 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, apply the healing from this spell to the creature. If the healed creature's hit point total is at a negative amount less than its {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score, it comes back to life and stabilizes at its new hit point total. If the creature's hit point total is at a negative amount equal to or greater than its Constitution score, the creature remains dead. Creatures brought back to life through breath of life gain a temporary negative level that lasts for 1 day.
Creatures slain by {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} effects cannot be saved by breath of life.
Like cure spells, breath of life deals damage to undead creatures rather than curing them, and cannot bring them back to life.
2f1b2483-6867-45be-ac72-c2fd8fb3526d:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} curses the creature touched, making it inimical to the natural world. All animals have an initial attitude of hostile toward the target. If the target has an animal companion, it does not become hostile, but as long as the target remains cursed, their animal companion takes a â€“2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. The target also takes a â€“10 penalty on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} as the weather and environment themselves seem to conspire to cause trouble.
Nature's exile can be removed with break enchantment, limited wish, miracle, remove curse, or wish.
a5c4a34e-3454-493e-800b-62c6f8e2bfd2: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} enables you or a creature you {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g} to move and {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} normally for the duration of the spell, even under the influence of magic that usually impedes movement, such as paralysis, solid fog, slow, and web. All {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to grapple the target automatically fail.
3eb4a524-5d5c-4561-a5fc-ad7379de2b93: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} evaporates moisture from the body of each subject living creature, causing flesh to wither and crack and crumble to dust. This deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d6). This spell is especially devastating to water elementals and plant creatures, which instead take 1d8 points of damage per caster level (maximum 20d8).
16079214-6ce4-4a56-94d7-264e3a06198c: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} fills a single subject with a feeling of horrible dread that causes it to become shaken.
a4efc926-9a74-4ac9-b7b4-511b604b766e: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} forces an extraplanar creature back to its proper plane if it fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. If the spell is successful, the creature is instantly whisked away.
fb00b951-d54c-4547-b8e9-a000d24f3f70: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} frees victims from enchantments, transmutations, and curses.[LONGSTART] Break enchantment can reverse even an instantaneous effect. For each such effect, you make a {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + caster level, maximum +15) against a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 11 + caster level of the effect. Success means that the creature is free of the spell, curse, or effect. Break enchantment only works on spells of 5th level or lower.[LONGEND]
b24c9baf-b0c5-4dae-89d8-6b087490f7a0:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as cacophonous call, except that is affects multiple creatures.
Cacophonous Call: You fill your target's mind with a blaring cacophony of discordant sounds, making it hard for the target to act and {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentrate{/g}. The creature gains the nauseated condition for the duration of the spell if it fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}.
8bfb7c8a-85dd-4d73-af52-bfe0a9c89502:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as castigate, except it affects many creatures.
Castigate: You compel the target to beg for forgiveness. On a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}, the target cowers in fear. On a successful save, it is instead shaken for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Each round after, a cowering subject may attempt a new save to end the effect.
96ce1a8e-ef0f-48b0-9033-be0425cf2948:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as chameleon stride, except it confers its {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} upon all allies within 10 feet of you at the time the spell is cast. If an affected creature moves more than 10 feet away from you, it loses the benefit of the spell. Creatures that move into the area after the spell is cast do not gain its benefit.
Chameleon Stride: You fade into the background, and while you are not truly invisible, you are hard to pinpoint due to your translucent state. While under the effects of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, you gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g} and have {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} from creatures more than 5 feet away ({g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} have a 20% miss chance).
c86f8461-86fe-4d64-9a1f-a7eba77a9165: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as dragonkind I except that it also allows you to assume the form of a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}large{/g} dragon-like creature. You gain the following abilities: a +6 polymorph {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +4 polymorph bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 5/magic, and resistance to one element. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g}), two claws (1d8), two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d6), and one tail slap attack (1d8). You can only use the breath weapon twice per casting of this spell (when you use it, the duration of your breath weapon ability is reduced by 1/2 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} minutes), and you must wait 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} between uses. All breath weapons deal 8d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. Line breath weapons increase to 80-foot lines and cones increase to 40-foot cones.
30eebb7f-8c2d-4c6b-a5f5-5b319422a648: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as dragonkind II save that it also allows you to take the form of a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}huge{/g} dragon-like creature. You gain the following abilities: a +10 polymorph {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +8 polymorph bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +8 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, blindsense with a range of 60 feet, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 10/magic, frightful presence ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equal to the DC for this spell), and immunity to one element. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g}), two claws (2d6), two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d8), and one tail slap attack (2d6). You can use the breath weapon as often as you like, but you must wait 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} between uses. All breath weapons deal 12d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. Line breath weapons increase to 100-foot lines and cones increase to 50-foot cones.
dd0616bc-a2a6-4a80-b0a9-a84d5e25f2ea: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as entangle, except it sets the foliage on fire. A creature that begins its turn entangled by the spell takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} (a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} halves this {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}), and a creature that begins its turn in the area but is not entangled takes 2d6 points of fire damage (a successful Reflex save negates this damage). Smoke rising from the vines partially obscures visibility. {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}Attacks{/g} made in the smoke or against anything in the smoke must contend with {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (20% miss chance). When the spell's duration expires, the vines burn away entirely.
c232e91c-c618-4c9e-995a-14473a3f34a2:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as entangle, except the plants are coated with an irritating sap that creates a painful, itching rash on creatures that {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g} them. Any creature that enters the area must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or be sickened as long as it remains in the area and for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} afterward. Creatures that remain in the area must save each round. This is a poison effect.
Entangle: This spell causes tall grass, weeds, and other plants to wrap around creatures in the area of effect or those that enter the area. Creatures that fail their save gain the entangled condition. Creatures that make their save can move as normal, but those that remain in the area must save again each round. Creatures that move into the area must save immediately.
Entangled creatures can break free by making a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics check{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility check{/g} against the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this spell every round.
The entire area of effect is considered difficult terrain while the effect lasts.
3faaa4bc-0692-49a5-aa18-cec96d891c82: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as entangle, except the plants latch on to targets and drain away their vitality. Any creature that fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} to avoid becoming entangled or fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} to break free takes 1d2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}Constitution damage{/g}.
7d7529dd-312b-4cfd-97da-257f81519e35: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as false life, except you gain temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d10{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +20).
34cc5e9f-a336-485e-a608-5d08c3874bab:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as fester, except that it affects multiple foes.
Fester: Necrotic energy permeates the target, blocking {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} abilities. The subject gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 12 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} against effects that restore {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} or grant temporary hit points. If the target succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g}, fester lasts only a single {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
b0a722d8-6939-4dd6-9e6d-9f77f28da9eb: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as fireball except you can control the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to your allies; a controlled fireball deals minimum damage to them.
6c97fb32-9005-4a7d-b6bf-7c0e5bc7c104:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as flare, except it affects all creatures in a 10-foot-radius burst from the target point.
Flare: This {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrip{/g} creates a burst of light. If you cause the light to burst in front of a single creature, that creature is dazzled for 1 minute unless it makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}. Sightless creatures, as well as creatures already dazzled, are not affected by flare.
109a20d8-f8b2-41c0-8d41-94b6bb419553: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as raise dead, but it only affects an animal companion or a familiar.
59809d31-4505-4584-933a-e6984519183e:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like angelic aspect, except you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 10/evil; immunity to acid and cold; resistance to electricity and fire 10; a +4 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against poison; and protective aura as {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural ability{/g} for the duration of the spell.
Protective aura provides a +4 deflection bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on saving throws against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made or effects created by evil creatures to anyone within 20 feet. Otherwise, it functions as a magic circle against evil and a lesser globe of invulnerability, both with a radius of 20 feet.
Angelic Aspect: You take on an aspect of an angelic being, including some of its physical characteristics. You gain resistance to acid and cold 10, and DR 5/evil. You also gain a +2 deflection bonus to AC and a +2 resistance bonus on saves against attacks made or effects created by evil creatures. In addition, your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} and any weapons you wield are considered {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction.
293116bf-c183-4f68-bbcf-febeb6c6a258:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like animal aspect, except you gain one aspect that adds effects to the aspects that animal aspect grants.
Gorilla: You gain a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}, and a +1 competence bonus on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.
Monkey: You gain a +4 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility checks{/g}.
Raccoon: Your competence bonuses on {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g} increase to +4.
Raptor: Your enhancement bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} increases to +30 feet.
92867f56-4da4-43bf-b5e4-0a48bf2d0a96:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like bear's endurance, except that it affects all allies in a 30-foot radius of the caster.
Bear's Endurance: The affected creature gains greater vitality and stamina. The spell grants the subject a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, which adds the usual benefits to {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}, Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, Constitution {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, and so forth.[LONGSTART] Hit points gained by a temporary increase in Constitution score are not temporary hit points. They go away when the subject's Constitution drops back to normal. They are not lost first as temporary hit points are.[LONGEND]
56506659-6aa3-46a9-9b44-e8c837765e6e:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like blessing of luck and resolve, except that it affects multiple creatures.
Blessing of Luck and Resolve: A favored blessing of halfling clerics, this spell grants its target a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects. If the target fails a saving throw against fear, it {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rerolls{/g} the save with a +4 morale bonus and takes the new result, even if it is worse. After that, the spell's effect ends. If the target has the fearless racial {g|Encyclopedia:Trait}trait{/g}, it is immune to fear instead.
e480f724-0396-4fc5-9f54-782d1f6931b7:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like bull's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strength{/g}, except that it affects all allies in a 30-foot radius of the caster.
Bull's Strength: The subject becomes stronger. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to Strength, adding the usual benefits to {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and other uses of the Strength modifier.[LONGSTART] Enhancement bonuses do not stack with other enhancement bonuses, for example with bonuses from belts.[LONGEND]
6c47c8da-2e4c-4d41-b2ae-bf1d19c8b88c:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like call lightning, except that each bolt deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} at long range, and you may call a maximum of 15 bolts.
Call Lightning: Immediately upon completion of the spell, and once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} thereafter, you may call down a bolt of lightning that deals 3d6 points of electricity {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. The bolt of lightning flashes down in a vertical stroke at whatever target point you choose within the spell's range (measured from your position at the time). Any creature in the target square or in the path of the bolt is affected. You need not call a bolt of lightning immediately; other {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, even spellcasting, can be performed first. Each round after the first, you may use a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentrating{/g} on the spell) to call a bolt. Each time you cast a bolt, the spell's duration is reduced by one minute.
859f1c5c-d417-4194-bac3-079f43c54eeb:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like cat's grace, except that it affects all allies in a 30-foot radius of the caster.
Cat's Grace: The transmuted creature becomes more graceful, agile, and coordinated. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, adding the usual benefits to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, and other uses of the Dexterity modifier.[LONGSTART] Enhancement bonuses do not stack with other enhancement bonuses, for example with bonuses from belts.[LONGEND]
7d80a42b-eeb0-4cdb-8da7-24af4fa03ff8: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like command, except this spell affects multiple enemies in a 30-foot radius, and the activities continue beyond 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At the start of each commanded creature's turn after the first, it gets another {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to attempt to break free from the spell. Each creature must receive the same command.
82cb9f26-8c8e-430a-8f87-11699b9b9af1:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like command, except this spell affects multiple enemies in a 30-foot radius, and the activities continue beyond 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At the start of each commanded creature's {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} after the first, it gets another {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to attempt to break free from the spell. Each creature must receive the same command.
Approach: On its turn, the subject moves toward you as quickly and directly as possible for 1 round. The creature may do nothing but move during its turn, and it provokes {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} for this movement as normal.
f97e2fda-8f61-4ed6-968c-42cc0ecb16a7:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like command, except this spell affects multiple enemies in a 30-foot radius, and the activities continue beyond 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At the start of each commanded creature's {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} after the first, it gets another {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to attempt to break free from the spell. Each creature must receive the same command.
Fall: On its turn, the subject falls to the ground and remains prone for 1 round. It may act normally while prone but takes any appropriate {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g}.
a78f438f-8fc4-43b2-951e-c9d20f12d6fc:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like command, except this spell affects multiple enemies in a 30-foot radius, and the activities continue beyond 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At the start of each commanded creature's {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} after the first, it gets another {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to attempt to break free from the spell. Each creature must receive the same command.
Flee: On its turn, the subject moves away from you as quickly as possible for 1 round. It may do nothing but move during its turn, and it provokes {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} for this movement as normal.
f14ad032-9af5-4c3d-8b54-c40aa69e3022:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like command, except this spell affects multiple enemies in a 30-foot radius, and the activities continue beyond 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At the start of each commanded creature's {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} after the first, it gets another {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to attempt to break free from the spell. Each creature must receive the same command.
Halt: The subject stands in place for 1 round. It may not take any actions but is not considered {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}.
8da7e817-84cf-40b8-be2d-a0f50bc7ebaa:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like dominate person, except that the spell is not restricted by creature type.
Dominate Person: You can make any humanoid creature fight on your side as if it was your ally. It will {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability. However, this creature will try to throw off the domination, making a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
d4e9ddd1-a36a-418d-8905-6553eacfae53:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like dominate person, except that the spell is restricted by creature type: animal.
Dominate Person: You can make any humanoid creature fight on your side as if it was your ally. It will {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability. However, this creature will try to throw off the domination, making a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
1864260e-784b-452b-92f5-04c12a1a08da:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like eagle's splendor, except that it affects all allies in a 30-foot radius of the caster.
Eagle's Splendor: The transmuted creature becomes more poised, articulate, and personally forceful. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, adding the usual benefits to Charisma-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} and other uses of the Charisma modifier.[LONGSTART] Bards, paladins, and sorcerers (and other spellcasters who rely on Charisma) affected by this spell do not gain any additional bonus spells for the increased Charisma, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs for spells they cast while under this spell's effect do increase.[LONGEND]
7b6a601e-5afc-4c2c-8c95-1c3d91af93ef:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like fox's cunning, except that it affects all allies in a 30-foot radius of the caster.
Fox's Cunning: The target becomes smarter. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, adding the usual benefits to Intelligence-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} and other uses of the Intelligence modifier.[LONGSTART] Wizards (and other spellcasters who rely on Intelligence) affected by this spell do not gain any additional bonus spells for the increased Intelligence, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs for spells they cast while under this spell's effect do increase. This spell doesn't grant extra skill ranks.[LONGEND]
74ae97a5-c976-4635-b378-7c34c2fb5efe: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like heroism, except the creature gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, immunity to fear effects, and temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20).
7232cf2a-904b-423d-884b-a00e532164fb:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like hold monster, except that the target is constricted as if by the coils of a large snake, taking {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g}+6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} that it fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g}. A successful save ends both the paralyzing and constriction effects.
Hold Monster: The subject becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cannot take any {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, even speech. Each round, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect.
4a5b1776-46d6-4725-8fb5-7005a7611bb9:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like hold person, except it targets all hostile creatures within a 30-foot radius from the target and holds any living creature that fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}.
Hold Person: The subject becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cannot take any {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, even speech. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect.
21f5c805-20a1-4884-a00e-ee4ff644941e:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like hold person, except it targets all hostile creatures within a 30-foot radius from the target.
Hold Person: The subject becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cannot take any {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, even speech. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the subject may attempt a new Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} to end the effect.
865cfa88-c535-45e8-9e64-063f09209eff:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like hold person, except that it affects any living creature that fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}.
Hold Person: The subject becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cannot take any {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, even speech. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect.
f65fe964-38d4-4f34-b125-8f8a1a2422a1:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like invisibility, except that it doesn't end if the subject {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
Invisibility: The touched creature becomes invisible.
If a {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} is required, an invisible creature has a +20 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on its {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g}. The spell ends if the subject attacks any creature.[LONGSTART] For purposes of this spell, an attack includes any {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Target}spell targeting{/g} a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. Exactly who is a foe depends on the invisible character's {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}perceptions{/g}. {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}Actions{/g} directed at unattended objects do not break the spell. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. Thus, an invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon monsters and have them attack, cut the ropes holding a rope bridge while enemies are on the bridge, remotely trigger traps, open a portcullis to release attack dogs, and so forth. If the subject attacks directly, however, it immediately becomes visible along with all its gear. Spells such as bless that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area.[LONGEND]
bb8448b5-11bc-415f-b9cd-3743078bfdfc:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like lesser {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}restoration{/g}, except that it also dispels temporary negative levels or one permanent negative level.
Restoration cures all temporary {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, and it restores all points permanently drained from a single {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g}. It also eliminates any fatigue or exhaustion suffered by the target.
Lesser Restoration: This spell dispels any temporary magical effects reducing one of the subject's ability scores (it does not remove permanent effects such as curses or diseases) or cures {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of temporary ability {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one of the subject's ability scores. It also eliminates any fatigue suffered by the character. It does not restore permanent ability drain.
cfafffc3-5481-41f1-a007-b9ab88dae597:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like lesser {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}restoration{/g}, except that it dispels all permanent and temporary negative levels afflicting the healed creature. Greater restoration also dispels all magical effects penalizing the creature's abilities, cures all temporary {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, and restores all points permanently drained from all {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g}. It also eliminates fatigue and exhaustion, and removes all forms of insanity, confusion, and similar mental effects.
Lesser Restoration: This spell dispels any temporary magical effects reducing one of the subject's ability scores (it does not remove permanent effects such as curses or diseases) or cures {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of temporary ability {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one of the subject's ability scores. It also eliminates any fatigue suffered by the character. It does not restore permanent ability drain.
4e672518-0c7a-4aee-9e7d-1d3cd8b7f60f: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like magic weapon, except that it gives a weapon an enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} of +1 per four {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum +5). This bonus does not allow a weapon to bypass {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} aside from magic.
448949e7-42f6-4df6-8c36-49b0eb48842a:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like mind blank, except it affects all party members and it lasts for 4 hours.
Mind Blank: This spell grants a +8 resistance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against all mind-affecting spells and effects. The subject is also protected from all items, spells, and other effects that gather information about the target through divination magic (such as thoughtsense, true seeing, and see invisibility).
12625c69-35ac-4063-b0ff-b9e89f0c6e7d:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like owl's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}wisdom{/g}, except that it affects all allies in a 30-foot radius of the caster.
Owl's Wisdom: The transmuted creature becomes wiser. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to Wisdom, adding the usual benefit to Wisdom-related {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.[LONGSTART] Clerics, druids, and rangers (and other Wisdom-based spellcasters) who receive owl's wisdom do not gain any additional bonus spells for the increased Wisdom, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs for their spells increase.[LONGEND]
8201c42e-ffcf-4f44-b953-8a440330907d:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like phantasmal killer, except it can affect more than one creature. Only the affected creatures see the phantasmal creatures {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacking{/g} them, though you see the attackers as shadowy shapes.
If a subject's {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} succeeds, it still takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and is stunned for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The subject also takes 1d4 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} damage.
Phantasmal Killer: You create a phantasmal image of the most fearsome creature imaginable to the subject simply by forming the fears of the subject's subconscious mind into something that its conscious mind can visualize: this most horrible beast. Only the spell's subject can see the phantasmal killer. You see only a vague shape. The target first gets a Will save to recognize the image as unreal. If that save fails, the phantasm touches the subject, and the subject must succeed on a Fortitude save or die from fear. Even if the Fortitude save is successful, the subject takes 3d6 points of damage.
1893195f-61a7-4ced-9275-18ef3b75628c:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like raise dead, except that you are able to restore life and complete strength to any deceased creature, even the ones killed by {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} effect or disintegration.
Upon completion of the spell, the creature is immediately restored to full {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}, vigor, and health, with no loss of prepared spells.
7d09b73e-7e58-40e7-9429-775fb4fc5fdf: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like shadow conjuration, except that it duplicates any sorcerer or wizard conjuration (summoning) or conjuration (creation) spell of 6th level or lower. The illusory conjurations created deal three-fifths (60%) {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to nonbelievers, and non-damaging effects are 60% likely to work against nonbelievers.
50a0d7fb-c32d-4a2b-a75e-d50ddf638cf1: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like shadow conjuration, except that it mimics conjuration spells of 8th level or lower. The illusory conjurations created deal four-fifths (80%) {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to nonbelievers, and non-damaging effects are 80% likely to work against nonbelievers.
b962baf9-88c5-4a4f-8f3c-482d8c181dd4:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like shadow evocation, except that it enables you to create a partially real, illusory version of a chain lightning, cold ice strike, ki shout, sirocco, caustic eruption, or elemental assessor spell. If recognized as a greater shadow evocation, a damaging spell deals only three-fifths (60%) {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
Shadow Evocation: You tap energy from the Plane of Shadow to cast a quasi-real, illusory version of a fireball, lightning bolt, shout, volcanic storm, or ice storm spell. Spells that deal damage have normal effects unless an affected creature succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. Each disbelieving creature takes only one-fifth damage from the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. Regardless of the result of the save to disbelieve, an affected creature is also allowed any save (or {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}) that the spell being simulated allows, but the save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is set according to shadow evocation's level (5th) rather than the spell's normal level.
66ff829d-1d61-49bf-8fbc-7935fe5d30f2: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like shout, except that the cone deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}10d6{/g} points of sonic {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. It also causes creatures to be stunned for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A creature in the area of the cone can negate the stunning and halve the damage with a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g}.
f7004a79-277a-48c5-aa75-11afcbcd9084:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like sleep, except that it affects 10 HD of targets.
Sleep: A sleep spell causes a magical slumber to come upon 4 HD of creatures, and those who are closest to the spell's point of origin are affected first. HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted. Sleeping creatures are {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}. Wounding awakens an affected creature, but normal noise does not. Sleep does not target {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} creatures, constructs, or undead creatures.
4634c1b9-67f2-4229-a880-d56051f298b0:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g}, except it targets all creatures within a 30-foot radius. The maximum number of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} restored to each creature is 250.
Heal: Heal enables you to channel positive energy into a creature to wipe away {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}injury{/g} and afflictions. It immediately ends any and all of the following adverse conditions affecting the target: {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, blinded, confused, dazed, dazzled, diseased, exhausted, fatigued, nauseated, poisoned, sickened, and stunned. It also cures 10 hit points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per level of the caster, to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level.
Heal does not remove negative levels or restore permanently drained {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} points.
If used against an undead creature, heal instead acts like harm.
a8d980ff-e818-4302-bdab-d1d94e1d2dac:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} generates a bank of fog, its vapors yellowish green and poisonous. These vapors automatically kill any living creature with 3 or fewer HD (no {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g}). A living creature with 4 to 6 HD is slain unless it succeeds at a Fortitude save (in which case it takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} while in the cloud).
A living creature with more than 6 HD takes 1d4 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}Constitution damage{/g} each round while in the cloud (a successful Fortitude save halves this damage). Holding one's breath doesn't help, but creatures immune to poison are unaffected by the spell.
The cloudkill moves away from you at 10 feet per round in the direction you are facing, rolling along the surface of the ground.
39b106dd-5450-46af-9c31-ae51db576e8d: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} gives you a +10-foot enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. It has no effect on other modes of movement, such as burrow, climb, fly, or swim.

8bd69e4a-2cf4-4842-9835-4350ab800b89:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} tears a rift in reality, creating an extradimensional hole with a depth of 60 feet. Since the rift extends into the Abyss, it does not displace the original underlying material or allow access to areas below the surface â€” you can create the rift on the deck of a ship as easily as in a dungeon floor or the ground of a forest.
Any large or smaller creature standing in the area where you first conjured the rift must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} to jump to safety in the nearest open space. In addition, the edges of the rift are sloped, and any creature ending its turn on a square adjacent to the rift must make a Reflex saving throw with a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to avoid falling into it. Creatures subjected to an effect intended to push them into the rift (such as bull rush) do not get a saving throw to avoid falling in if they are affected by the pushing effect.
The walls of the rift are covered with razor-sharp blades, while the floor seethes with boiling pools of acid, strange chewing vermin, writhing shards of ice, and all manner of other chaotic and deadly manifestations of the Abyss. A creature that falls into the rift takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}6d6{/g} points of falling {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Any creature in the rift (starting on the {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} it enters) takes an additional 6d6 points of damage from the rift's environs, even if the creature is merely climbing or flying within the rift rather than standing at the bottom. This additional damage changes from round to round and is randomly selected from acid, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning{/g}, cold, electricity, fire, piercing, slashing, or sonic. Each round, a creature in the rift can attempt a Reflex save to take half damage that round. To climb the rift's walls, a creature need a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 35.
When this spell's duration ends, the rift snaps shut, violently expelling all creatures still within. These creatures take double damage from the rift's environs in that round and are knocked prone as they are returned to the surface above.
a0ac2e0e-7cab-4edd-b7bc-7947acf0e1e5: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} transforms an allied creature into a large smilodon, shambling mound, elemental, wyvern or {g|Encyclopedia:Size}medium{/g} dragon-like creature. The subject may choose to resume its normal form as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}; doing so ends the spell for that subject.
f3b3b6f3-ce24-47e7-9866-ade77e8ecfb6: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} transforms an allied creature into a leopard or a small elemental. The subject may choose to resume its normal form as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}; doing so ends the spell for that subject.
213350ef-04c1-4d02-a49f-7f4e4f316bf9:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} transforms your body into living flame. You and your equipment are immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}. In fact, every time you would normally take {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from fire, you are instead {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} of damage at a rate of 1 point per 3 points of damage the fire {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} would have normally inflicted. You are immune to blindness, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} damage, disease, electricity, poison, and stunning. You have acid resistance 30. You take 150% as much damage from cold as normal.
You have a +6 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} score. Your {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attack{/g} deals an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}3d6{/g} points of fire damage, and you are considered armed when making unarmed attacks. Fire spells you cast have their {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs increased by +1.
8db561de-86d0-483f-b819-37667c2464e2:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} transforms your body into living iron, which grants you several powerful resistances and abilities. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 15/adamantine. You are immune to blindness, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, disease, drowning, electricity, poison, stunning, and all spells or {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} that affect your physiology or respiration, because you have no physiology or respiration while this spell is in effect. You have acid and fire resistance 30.
You gain a +6 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} score, but you take a -6 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} as well (to a minimum Dexterity score of 1), and your {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is reduced to half normal. You have an {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g} of 35% and a -6 {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g}, just as if you were clad in full plate armor.
Your {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attack{/g} deals damage equal to a club sized for you ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} for Small characters or 1d6 for Medium characters), and you are considered armed when making unarmed attacks.
7df03566-25c8-4f16-90ac-30037b1eea2f: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} transforms your hands into living stone. While this spell is in effect, your {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strikes do not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} and deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning damage{/g} (1d4 if you are Small).
62b0cd39-94fb-4f78-8e19-85fa41f0ae10:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} works as beast shape III, except you change the form of every ally in 10 ft. area into a Large bear.
Beast Shape III: You become a Large bear. You gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also have two {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, one 1d6 bite attack, and the rend ability.
Rend: When a bear hits an opponent with both its claws, it deals an additional 1d6 plus 1.5 times its Strength modifier points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing damage{/g}. It can only deal this additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} once each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
dc3253ec-eaa4-4f9b-97a6-d10ae32b72c9: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} wreathes you in shadowy energy and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damages{/g} those that make {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} against you. Any creature that strikes you with its body or a handheld weapon deals normal damage, but at the same time the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacker{/g} takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of negative {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +15). If the attacker has {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}, it applies to this effect. When an attacker takes damage from this spell, you {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} a number of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to 25% of the damage the spell dealt. Creatures with {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} weapons are not subject to this damage if they attack you.
e224fddd-e7f9-42bd-b919-d14f2c881e2a:
Three missiles of magical energy dart forth from your fingertip and strike their target, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 points of force {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each.
These missiles strike their targets unerringly, even if the target is in melee combat, so long as it has less than total cover or total {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}.
643bcdc4-b588-424c-bcf7-3d6d32099732: Undeath to Death destroys undead creatures. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slays {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} HD worth of undead creatures per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d4). Those who are closest to the burst's point of origin are affected first. All creatures with 9 or less HD are slain outright, while creatures with more than 9 HD take 100 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} instead. HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.
a23d125f-7c14-4448-8436-30ca089fdab9: Until the end of the {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, your movement does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}.
5a04554b-49ba-4aa5-9293-8451fda97501:
Upon casting this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, you must choose one type of genie to transform into, selecting from djinni, efreeti, marid, or shaitan. You retain your basic physical appearance but shift in some way to become more akin to the genie type you chose. While under the effects of geniekind, you gain a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against paralysis, poison, sleep, and stunning effects, and a +4 enhancement bonus to your natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. You also gain a +2 enhancement bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}. You are also unaffected by difficult terrain. In addition, you gain other abilities depending upon the type of genie you choose to assume the form of, as detailed below.
Djinni: Your {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strikes and any melee weapon you wield deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}+1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g}. You gain resist electricity 10.
Efreeti: Your unarmed strikes and any melee weapon you wield deal +1d6 points of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. You gain resist fire 10.
Marid: Your unarmed strikes and any melee weapon you wield deal +1d6 points of cold damage. You gain resist cold 10.
Shaitan: Your unarmed strikes and any melee weapon you wield deal +1d6 points of acid damage. You gain resist acid 10.
5d694b8c-38c8-457e-aced-41966f02d04c: Upon casting this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, you target a living creature that has â€“1 or fewer {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}. That creature is automatically stabilized and does not lose any further hit points. If the creature later takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, it continues dying normally.
87dcd31e-fda3-48dd-a77f-8e433c770556: Using this scroll absolves you of your sins and returns your {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} to the state it was at the 1st level.
3cbee036-4b29-48c3-8158-f3438852f0f0: Using words of ancient power, you bestow heroic powers on all creatures subject to this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. They gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, gain {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g}+4 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}, and become immune to both fear and charm effects for the spell's duration.
3bc42192-c64a-463d-afd7-6e1496531049:
Vines choked with thorns, blossoms, leaflets, and other floral debris burst to life on and around the subject of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
When this spell is cast, the subject becomes paralyzed and entangled, though a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} negates the paralysis. Each following {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end both the paralysis and the entangle effects.
The subject takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} each turn from the sharp thorns. This {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} is considered to be cold iron for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
45eefda0-471a-43fa-b85c-5f0eac17956e: Waves of negative energy cause all living creatures in the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s area to become exhausted. This spell has no effect on a creature that is already exhausted.
d8977775-d576-4eca-af62-10a3bcc89ce3: Waves of negative energy render all living creatures in the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s area fatigued. This spell has no effect on a creature that is already fatigued.
be937064-2b6a-4d26-8f5e-ffccb6f3992f:
Web creates a many-layered mass of strong, sticky strands. These strands trap those caught in them. The strands are similar to spiderwebs but far larger and tougher. Creatures caught within a web become grappled by the sticky fibers.
Anyone in the effect's area when the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is cast must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g}. If this save succeeds, the creature is inside the web but is otherwise unaffected. If the save fails, the creature gains the grappled condition, but can break free by making a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics check{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility check{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} against the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this spell. The entire area of the web is considered difficult terrain. Anyone moving through the webs must make a Reflex save each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Creatures that fail lose their movement and become grappled in the first square of webbing that they enter.
d81945a6-54c0-4be3-8ea4-768db0a667d8: When a fire storm {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is cast, the whole area is shot through with sheets of roaring flame. All enemy creatures within the area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d6). Creatures that fail their {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} catch on fire, taking 4d6 points of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after that until the flames are extinguished by making a successful Reflex save.
6d0c919e-a10b-4250-8dd0-19cb4541f336:
When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +5).
Since undead are powered by negative energy, this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} cures such a creature of a like amount of damage, rather than harming it.
b4494078-cdb8-4922-b7ea-fa5bd0248743:
When laying your hand upon a creature, you channel negative energy that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +10).

Constricting Vines: A shambling mound's vines coil around any creature it hits with a slam attack. The shambling mound attempts a grapple {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} against its target, and on a successful check its vines deal 2d6+5 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and the foe is grappled.
Grappled characters cannot move, and take a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all attack rolls and a -4 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. Grappled characters attempt to escape every {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} by making a successful combat maneuver, Strength, {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility check{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this check is the shambling mound's {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}.
Each round, creatures grappled by a shambling mound suffer (4d6 + twice the Strength modifier) damage.
A shambling mound receives a +4 bonus on grapple maneuver checks.
Poison:
Slam; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude
Frequency: 1/round for 2 rounds
Effect: 1d2 Strength and 1d2 {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}Dexterity damage{/g}
Cure: 1 save
The save DC is Constitution-based.

7e4b19a5-2385-48af-a49c-5da56b2f7b44: You blast your enemies with a searing beam of fire. f57bab25-a084-4cc8-83c4-1068166e3822: You blast your enemies with a searing beam of fire. 21213cda-42ea-4a6f-a42f-db71be2783b9: You call forth a burst of decay that ravages all creatures in the area.
